item.title: A perfectly normally distributed sample: another post?
item.description: Recently, we published a post presenting a small convenience function, from the bayestestR package. This function, named rnorm_perfect, generated an empirical distribution (i.e., a vector of values) as close as possible to a desired distribution, in this case the normal distribution. It worked like this: # Generate a perfect sample x <- rnorm_perfect(n = 100, mean = 0, sd = 1) # Visualise it library(tidyverse) x %>% density() %>% # Compute density function as.
